title: 108_hr5068
content: The Department of Homeland Security Cybersecurity Enhancement Act of 2004 establishes an Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity under the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The Department of Homeland Security Cybersecurity Enhancement Act of 2004 creates a National Cybersecurity Office within the Directorate for Information Analysis and Infrastructure Protection. The Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity is responsible for leading cybersecurity efforts and managing critical infrastructure protection programs. Responsibilities include establishing a national cybersecurity response system. The National Cybersecurity Office under the Department of Homeland Security is tasked with analyzing cybersecurity threats to critical infrastructure, detecting and warning of attacks, and restoring cybersecurity infrastructure post-attack. Additionally, they run a program to reduce cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities on a national level, conduct vulnerability assessments, and coordinate mitigation efforts. There is also a program focused on promoting cybersecurity awareness and training. The National Cybersecurity Office oversees programs promoting cybersecurity awareness, coordinating with government sectors, and fostering international cybersecurity cooperation. They also collaborate with the private sector for information sharing and threat warnings regarding critical infrastructure. The National Cybersecurity Office coordinates with other government departments on cybersecurity aspects, ensures recovery measures for critical infrastructure, and promotes information sharing with the private sector for cybersecurity best practices. The National Cybersecurity Office coordinates with government departments, private sector, and other entities to establish secure information sharing processes, consults with various agencies for cybersecurity scenarios in exercises, and collaborates with the Electronic Crimes Task Force for private sector outreach. The National Cybersecurity Office collaborates with other Federal agencies on cybersecurity programs and policies, including the security of digital control systems. The Assistant Secretary has primary authority over the National Communications System within the Department. The Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity has primary authority over the National Communications System within the Department. Cybersecurity is defined in Section 3. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 defines cybersecurity as the prevention, protection, and restoration of computers and electronic communication systems to ensure availability, integrity, authentication, confidentiality, and nonrepudiation. The terms used in the definition are clarified in the amendment. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 defines cybersecurity as the protection of computers and electronic communication systems. The amendment clarifies the terms used in the definition.
